interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Hot Lead & Cold Feet
Review Date: 2013/01/15
Store: Jim Dale  (Actor),     Karen Valentine  (Actor),     Robert Butler  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    G    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Walt Disney Studios Home Entertainment, All Disney Titles
Product Description: ["There's magic in the memories as great Disney moments are captured right here for you and your family to enjoy. A two-gun terror and his terrified twin brother turn an old cowtown upside down. A blazing, rip-roaring, riotous saga of brotherly competition in a winner-take-all battle for an inheritance. Jim Dale (PETE'S DRAGON, UNIDENTIFIED FLYING ODDBALL) stars in a triple-header of a role, pulling all the stops out as he plays three different people: Old Jasper Bloodshy and his two sons.|Portions of the film were shot on location in Deschutes National Forest in Oregon, from Snowy Mt. Bachelor along the Cascade Range, across the Deschutes River gorge, to the black rocks of Lava Butte."]
Average Rating: 4.7

Review Text: We have it on VHS but wanted it on DVD.  It is a funny family movie.  We can watch it over and over.
Review Title: Great Movie
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------

Hot Lead & Cold Feet
Jim Dale  (Actor),     Karen Valentine  (Actor),     Robert Butler  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    G    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Walt Disney Studios Home Entertainment, All Disney Titles
["There's magic in the memories as great Disney moments are captured right here for you and your family to enjoy. A two-gun terror and his terrified twin brother turn an old cowtown upside down. A blazing, rip-roaring, riotous saga of brotherly competition in a winner-take-all battle for an inheritance. Jim Dale (PETE'S DRAGON, UNIDENTIFIED FLYING ODDBALL) stars in a triple-header of a role, pulling all the stops out as he plays three different people: Old Jasper Bloodshy and his two sons.|Portions of the film were shot on location in Deschutes National Forest in Oregon, from Snowy Mt. Bachelor along the Cascade Range, across the Deschutes River gorge, to the black rocks of Lava Butte."]

profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Media Format Preference:** Strong inclination towards DVDs, seeking to upgrade from VHS.
- **Genre Affinity:** Enjoys family-friendly content, particularly in action and comedy genres that can be appreciated by all ages. 
- **Viewing Frequency:** Values rewatchable films, indicating a preference for timeless classics that can be enjoyed multiple times.
- **Emotional Engagement:** Looks for films that capture magic and humor, suggesting an appreciation for nostalgic and light-hearted storytelling.
- **Ratings Behavior:** Generally positive, as indicated by a high average rating (4.7), showing discernment in selecting quality entertainment.
- **Purchase Behavior:** Engages with content from renowned studios like Disney, and has a particular interest in films with notable actors and directors.
- **Family-Oriented:** Emphasizes the importance of films that provide joy for the entire family, indicative of a family-centric viewing preference. 

This profile reflects a user who values quality family entertainment, particularly in accessible formats, and enjoys films that evoke a sense of nostalgia and humor.
